author: Brian Turner
method: Rub the tomato halves with one tablespoon of the oil and season well with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Place on a baking tray and roast for 8-10 minutes, or until cooked and soft. Heat the remaining tablespoon of oil in a frying pan and fry the onion and garlic for 2-3 minutes, until softened. Add the bacon and fry for 2-3 minutes, or until cooked through. Add the chicken livers and fry for 2-3 minutes on both sides until golden-brown all over and completely cooked through. To serve, spoon the chicken liver mixture into the tomato halves and place onto a warm plate.
ingredients: 1 beef tomato, halved, seeds removed,  2 tbsp olive oil,  ½ onion, sliced,  1 garlic clove, sliced,  50g/2oz smoked bacon, chopped,  100g/3½oz chicken livers, seasoned,  fresh parsley leaf, to garnish,  salt and freshly ground black pepper
